page.title: 15Aberford's Places of Worship
page.content: {St.Ricarius-}Church of England.No other church in Britain with that name.A wooden structure existed in Saxon times,a Norman tower still stands.Present building erected 1861.{ {Vicar-}Rev.B.Harris.{Organist-}Miss M.Lean.{Choirmistress-}Mrs M.Harris. {Sunday Services-}Communion 7.45am.and 10.30am.Evensong 6.00pm. {St.Wilfrid's Priory-}Roman Catholic. Built 1788.Contains some interesting Victorian stained glass windows.A formerschoolroom still stands at the rear.{Priest-}Mon.B.Gilmore.{Sunday {Services-}Mass 8.30am.Services are also held on Holy Days. {Methodist Chapel-}Originally built in 1814 but replaced by the present structure in 1912.The original organ is still in use today.{Minister-}Rev. A.Coustick.{Organist-}Yvonne {Richardson.Sunday Service-}10.30am.
